Subject: Global Asset Operation Reorganization
Body: in an effort to streamline the corporate center and in recognition of the two zero growing capabilities of enronzero one s regional wholesale business global asse ttwo zero operations will be reorganized effective one may two zero zero zero our current globaltwo zero asset operations functions will be decentralized and become a business unit two zero responsibility enron will continue to operate all of its facilities under standardizedtwo zero guidelines and procedures and compliance will be monitored through a formal two zero audit program as in the past however our wholesale business units will two zero assume responsibility for operation and management of their specific power two zero plants and other assets operational energy corporation oec will become the enron corp zero one center oftwo zero excellencezero one eight for power plant operations the gas pipeline group is the c entertwo zero of excellencezero one eight for pipeline operations oec will reside in enron north two zero america jim noles will be in charge of this activity mark dobler will two zero lead operations and john cates will lead the development support activity two zero john cateszero one organization will continue to provide om estimates and due two zero diligence assistance to business units john will specifically approve om two zero estimates for corporate risk assessment decisions jim noles and this new two zero group will report to the office of the chairman in enron north america the quality management group audit function will be assigned to the gas two zero pipeline group gpg don hawkins will continue to head quality management two zero and will report to phil lowry managing director operations gpg intwo zero addition to managing the global audit program don will continue histwo zero responsibility for standardized policies and procedures the crisistwo zero management program iso nine zero zero zero certification the positive impact programtwo zero operational reporting and the asset operations website the environmental health and safety ehs group led by henry van will repor ttwo zero to mike terraso enronzero one s chief environmental officer reporting to steve two zero kean as in the past henryzero one s group will continue to provide environmen taltwo zero and safety support to the regional business units enronzero one s wholesale business unitzero one s can now choose from a variety of se rvicestwo zero provided by oec these include full turnkey om services om estimates d uetwo zero diligence and technical support for planned and forced outages business two zero units are encouraged to take advantage of these services as they operate an dtwo zero maintain the power plants in their businesses kurt huneke will help transition the asset operations activity as discussed two zero herein while dedicating his full attention to enron wind company as itstwo zero chairman and ceo please join us in wishing these groups success

Subject: FERC Meeting on Northeast RTO
Body: northeast rto mediation report the commissioners heard a report from the alj who presided over the northea st rto mediation as you may recall the judge did not support our positio n which was to get a single northeast rto up and running with pjm leaders hip and based on the pjm system by no later than november two zero zero three the pjm pr oposal as expected the judge reiterated his disagreement with the pjm p roposal and urged the commission to take a go slower approach that includ es a minimum one two month upfront assessment of technology and best practices determinations two zero pat wood first questioned why the board makeup should consist of existing i so board members he acknowledged that the existing iso board members have experience but questioned whether the benefit of having their experience i s outweighed by the possibility of continued parochial interests that may b e retained by these board members he thinks perhaps the board should be m ade up of totally new board members ironically in the mediation only a c ouple of consumer advocatetypes supported this type of approach everyone else believed that using the existin iso board members makes more sense si nce they all have experience we supported a board makeup weighted in favo r of pjm so that implementation of the pjm system would be assured pat se ems to think this presents too much of a political problem pat also expressed concern that ferc not take action that would upset the e xisting functioning markets he said ferc should not force a result if it does not know what the outcome will be and could disrupt the existing mark ets he questioned whether they should take a different slower approach i n the northeast perhaps putting some regional functions into place soon e g interregional transmission planning and expansion and put off other i ssues a single real time balancing market that may be harder to implement at first pat says that technology assessment is a big issue and can be a show stopper if it is not done correctly under the pjm proposal the new rto would form by the end of the year and would start market design based on the pjm system immediately doing an upfront assesment could delay im plementation significantly he said perhaps some things can be done sooner than one eight two four months if he is thinking that longterm is one eight two four months then we could be okay because the pjm plan takes two four months to implement but his statements on technical assessment are troubling and sound like he may be willing to delay the startup of market design until this takes place on the positive side nora brownell reminded everyone that new york and pjm have very similar systems but they have a lot of problems working together and that these problems may be a hindrance to the developing retail market s she seems to think that things cannot remain as they are nothing was decided and it is unclear when ferc will issue an order in this proceeding we will keep you posted sarah

Subject: Parsons & Whittemore takes pulp downtime in New Brunswick
Body: paperloopcom san francisco aug two three two zero zero one paperloopcom parsons whittemore pw began a twoweek shutdown at st anne its northern bleached hardwood kraft pulp mill in nackawic nb monday due to market conditions the outage will trim about one zero five zero zero tonnes from the mills supplies or just over one six percent of its quarterly capacity a source at the company said the rye brook nybased firm hadnt slated marketbased curtailments this quarter but had planned about one four zero zero zero tonnes worth of maintenance closures the new brunswick mills downtime which the source said could produce seven five zero tonnesday of nbhk brings expected thirdquarter downtime at pw to about two four five zero zero tonnes a company official indicated that weak pricing conditions had prompted the shutdown we could sell pulp but were not going to sell at the price said the official who added we only ship to the us northeast by truck theres no rail siding so shipping is more expensive we have good longterm customers there so we made sure we had ample inventory before shutting down although much of st annes pulp is used for photographic paper and other specialty uses prices even for specialty grade nbhk have fallen deeply enough that freight costs have recently been more of a consideration for producers seeking to protect margins a company source added that systemwide there were no further marketrelated downtime plans through august
